Ur naive  sanctimonious take on recessions n COE prices reveal a staggering lvl of ignorance. No 1 fancy pandemics or recessions. These r catastrophic events that we cant choose or control. Ur simple suggestion: “If COE is too high  just don’t buy a car" show just how out of touch u r with the real world. Ppl need cars 2 live their lives  support their families n run their businesses. The reality is that COE prices r influenced by economic conditions n when a recession hits  it's not abt "fancying" it. It's abt bracing 4 impact  n yes  prices may drop cos demand weakens. That's not some ethical dilemma. it's the cold  hard truth of economics. So  b4 you spew this self-righteous nonsense again right  maybe get a grip on how the world actually works. It's not a matter of wanting or not wanting a crisis. it's abt understanding that we don't hv the luxury of choosing our circumstances.
